body:
I created Taffy because I was not happy with the amount of code it took to create REST API's with ColdFusion. I wanted something terse, something that used convention over configuration, and something that didn't require writing a bunch of boilerplate code. Nothing existed that filled that void, so I wrote it.

### Current Version
Officially, **the latest stable version is 1.0**, which you can get from the links above or from the "master" branch of the GitHub repository. 1.0 was [released](https://github.com/atuttle/Taffy/wiki/Releases) on August 23, 2010.

**But 1.1 is imminent.** In fact, the 1.1rc1 branch is considered stable, and the only reason I haven't officially labeled 1.1 as final/released is that I'd like to write a bit more documentation first.

And you know what? The only missing documentation is _a few_ examples. \([You can see the to-do list here.](https://github.com/atuttle/Taffy/wiki/So-you-want-to-\(Index\))\) All of the functionality/api is documented and ready to go. So really, there's not much left undone. It's just that writing documentation is tedious and takes a while. Sorry about that. But, if you're _a little bit_ brave, just go ahead and use 1.1. It's got [tons of bug fixes and new features](https://github.com/atuttle/Taffy/wiki/Roadmap#wiki-body), and in my opinion, is just better in many, many ways.

You can bet your belt buckle that the 1.1 branch and/or the documentation has been updated within the last month. So when anyone asks me which version to use, I say, unequivocally, without a doubt, use 1.1. Seriously. Just do it. Trust me.

### Documentation
Everything is documented in the GitHub wiki.

 * Using Taffy 1.0? [Index of the Taffy 1.0 Documentation](https://github.com/atuttle/Taffy/wiki/Taffy-1.0-Docs)
 * Using Taffy 1.1rc1? Everything not labeled Taffy 1.0 in the [List of Wiki Pages](https://github.com/atuttle/Taffy/wiki/_pages) applies! TONS of docs!

### Mailing List

Many people who use Taffy subscribe to the [Taffy Users Google Group](http://groups.google.com/group/taffy-users). If you're having any trouble, it's a great place to get advice or debugging help.
